title: What are the benefits of using modern technology in agriculture? - Quora

response.answer_text: Agriculture implements - connected to tractors and can do almost all work required at a farm, from preparing the field to harvesting. This reduces operational cost and required labour drastically. Micro irrigation systems - helps precisely water and feed the plants with the touch of a switch. This increases plant yield and increases revenue and eliminates the need for hum labour. Farm management software - helps the farmers be more proactive. It notifies the farmer on any nutrional defciency long before the lrlem arises on the plant itself. This in turn gives stronger and better yielding plants. Autonomous driving - tractors have become self driving requiring no driver to operated. The field is mapped for the tractor to follow. This is very helpful especially on hilly land where it is difficult to be precise and is also risky to work on. Digital farming - Control all irrigation and fertigation, along with your submersible pumps, centrifugal motors and generator all from the touch of a button on your phone. To summarise economic gain in terms of increased revenue and reduced operational costs help boost profit margins at your farm. The ROI period for all in a good market condition is usually withing 2.5 years. You will also see benefits in terms of less operational staff and labour thereby reducing your mental stress drastically allowing you to do farming with a peace of mind.
